location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No. 470: Lieutenant-Colonel Samuel Hennell, Resident in the Persian Gulf, Bushire, to His Excellency Lieutenant-Colonel Justin Sheil CB, Her Majesty's Minister Plenipotentiary and Envoy Extraordinary at the Court of Persia, Tehran

mods.abstract: Samuel Hennell informs Justin Sheil that Mirza Hassan Ally Khan, the newly appointed Durya Beggee, arrived at Bushire on 7 December. He states that Sheik Houssein remained for some days with his boats in the harbour but departed for Karrak [Bandar-e ChƒÅrak] shortly after the arrival of Mirza Hassan Ally Khan. Hennell writes that it has been reported that Hajee Kurram is to visit Bushire shortly and that the Sirteep, Moostufa Kooly Khan, has made it known that he will remain in Bushire until Hajee Kurram's arrival.
